Hamilton police arrest man after 26 high-end bikes were stolen - CHCH News Canada & The World Canada News Evening News Home Page News Story Local News Halton Hamilton Ontario News World News WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Search 20.1 C Hamilton Saturday, July 24, 2021 Personalities Contact Us Watch CHCH Live Now! CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Hamilton 50 local artists take part in a city-wide fundraiser for Joseph… Hamilton Two Row on the Grand Summer Camp Canada & The World Canadian government announces additional funding for Hamilton affordable housing Hamilton Two Niagara casinos open for the first time in 16 months WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home News Evening News Hamilton police arrest man after 26 high-end bikes were stolen News Evening News Local News Hamilton police arrest man after 26 high-end bikes were stolen By Laura Brody - December 24, 2019, 4:59 pm Hamilton police have arrested a man in connection with a two-month long investigation into stolen, high-end bikes worth more than $40 000. Police say they executed a search warrant at a home in the east end last Thursday and found 26 mountain bikes, along with bike parts, high-end skis and prohibited weapons. They believe the bikes were stolen from residential and commercial properties in Ancaster, Aldershot and Dundas. They say most of the bikes had been taken apart and the parts had been swapped, to try to disguise them. So far, police have returned 3 of the 26 bikes to their owners, and hope to return the rest of them in the next two weeks. Jason Kane, 43, of Hamilton, is facing a number of charges including two counts of possession of a prohibited weapon, and three counts of possession of stolen property. Police say the investigation is ongoing and more charges could be laid. They recommend that you record the serial number on your bike, and call police if it’s been stolen. Suspect identified in the murder of Obsa Junedi Mohamed - CHCH News Canada & The World Canada News Evening News Home Page News Story Local News Halton Hamilton Ontario News World News WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Search 20.1 C Hamilton Saturday, July 24, 2021 Personalities Contact Us Watch CHCH Live Now! CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Hamilton 50 local artists take part in a city-wide fundraiser for Joseph… Hamilton Two Row on the Grand Summer Camp Canada & The World Canadian government announces additional funding for Hamilton affordable housing Hamilton Two Niagara casinos open for the first time in 16 months WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home News Evening News Suspect identified in the murder of Obsa Junedi Mohamed News Evening News Local News Hamilton Home Page News Story Suspect identified in the murder of Obsa Junedi Mohamed By Laura Brody - October 21, 2019, 6:27 pm Hamilton police have identified the suspect in the city’s tenth homicide of the year, and have issued a warrant for his arrest. Twenty-nine year old Obsa Junedi Mohamed was gunned down outside of Boulevard Billiards on York Boulevard at around 1:30 Saturday morning. Police say his killer was his friend, 26-year-old Ibrahim Issak Hussen. The two men were hanging out with a group of other men for awhile before the shooting. About 10 minutes before the shooting detectives say Junedi Mohamed and Issak Hussen got into a physical altercation. Hussen goes by the street name “Seemo.” Junedi Mohamed’s street name was Nanny or Chappel. Detectives say Hussen shot Mohamed point blank in the head. The whole incident was caught on surveillance video. Surveillance images released in the media led to the driver of the getaway vehicle turning himself in to police on Saturday. That man was arrested for first degree murder and accessory after the fact to murder. Police say he participated in a lengthy interview and was released unconditionally later Saturday. But another man was also in the car and police want to speak to him. They are looking for an Asian male wearing a dark parka with fur trim on the hood. The victim was known to police. He was found by officers hiding after another shooting in the same area back in 2015. At the time he was charged with failing to comply and possession of cocaine. Issak Hussen is also known to police and investigators believe drugs are involved in this incident as well. News Evening News Local News Two Hamilton women were invited to meet Taylor Swift at the star’s Nashville mansion By Laura Brody - August 22, 2019, 5:23 pm Two young women from Hamilton were treated to an experience of a lifetime by their ultra-famous idol- Taylor Swift. The multi-grammy award winning pop star hand selected about 100 mega fans from around the world to attend a secret album preview party at her Nashville mansion and 25-year-old Nichole Ridehalgh and 17-year-old Isabella Rose both got a phone call from Swifts team. Ridehalgh was shocked when she called the call inviting her to a special event. She was asked if she could make it to Nashville in less than a week. Without being told, Ridehalgh knew she had just been invited to an event that is the pinnacle of every Taylor Swift fan’s dream- a secret session album preview at the star’s Nashville mansion. Swift has held secret sessions before the releases of several of her previous albums. Fans are picked up at a secret location and driven to her mansion. Those who attend are always mega fans who the star keeps a close eye on on social media. Getting a one on one chat with the star is something Ridehalgh will never forget. “Its 4:30 in the morning, I’m exhausted but, this is my moment. I walk into the room and I turn to my left and I see her and she says hey your Nichole right?Aand in that moment my whole world was made. Without me mentioning Canada at all, she said have a safe flight back to Canada” Swift even shared secret details about her personal life with fans. Isabella Rose is also on a first name basis with Swift. She posted on social media saying “I have loved her for nine years and I will never stop talking about how much I love her but I would not be where I am today without her.” Tonight is the release of Swift’s newest album, Lover. Ridehalgh and Rose were two of 113 fans in the world, that have already heard it. “She was lip syncing and dancing. She was just having a blast.” And that night is a night these young women will replay over and over again. The Ontario Life Saving Society says not wearing a life jacket was a factor in 88% of boat-related deaths. Alcohol played a part in 40% of boat-related deaths. There were 50 search and rescue calls in the Niagara Region in the year 2020. There have been 33 calls in 2021 so far. Home News Local News GO trains resume after pedestrian struck and killed by train in Burlington News Local News Top News Story GO trains resume after pedestrian struck and killed by train in Burlington By Shayla Vize - July 23, 2021, 6:43 am UPDATED Halton police are investigating after a pedestrian was struck and killed by a train in Burlington. It happened in the area of King and Enfield roads just east of Aldershot GO station early Friday. Halton police say the Collision Reconstruction Unit is investigating the incident. Police say there are no further details at this time. Police investigating pedestrian fatality involving train in area King/Enfield Rds @cityburlington. Investigation ongoing by Collision Reconstruction Unit. No further details at this time. Road traffic remains open. ^jwf — HRPS Burlington (@HRPSBurl) July 23, 2021 The Lakeshore West line experienced significant delays and cancellations as police investigated the incident. GO Transit said travel alternatives including buses running from West Harbour GO, Hamilton GO Centre, and Aldershot GO were arranged as trains were unable to move through the area. The tracks were cleared and reopened around 10 a.m. and regularly scheduled services resumed with some minor delays. Fatality investigation east of Aldershot GO is complete. The tracks have been cleared and have reopened. We will be returning to our regularly scheduled #GOtrain service with some minor delays. Niagara police investigate after man exposes himself to teen girl - CHCH News Canada & The World Canada News Evening News Home Page News Story Local News Halton Hamilton Ontario News World News WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Search 20.1 C Hamilton Saturday, July 24, 2021 Personalities Contact Us Watch CHCH Live Now! CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Hamilton 50 local artists take part in a city-wide fundraiser for Joseph… Hamilton Two Row on the Grand Summer Camp Canada & The World Canadian government announces additional funding for Hamilton affordable housing Hamilton Two Niagara casinos open for the first time in 16 months WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home News Local News Niagara police investigate after man exposes himself to teen girl News Local News Top News Story Niagara police investigate after man exposes himself to teen girl By Shayla Vize - July 23, 2021, 5:59 am Niagara police are investigating after a man exposed himself to a teen girl in West Lincoln. Police say the girl was walking home in the area of Canborough Rd. and Townline Rd. around 10:30 p.m. on July 10. A man who was sitting in a small dark coloured vehicle got out of his car and began walking towards the teen on the sidewalk. Police say the man stood on behind a fence and exposed himself. He then got back into his vehicle and left the area. There was no physical contact or conversation between the teen and suspect, police say. The man is described as white, between 20 and 30 years of age, with a medium build. Niagara police are also investigating a separate incident involving a teen girl and a suspicious man in the same area. On July 11, a teen reported to police she had been followed by a man while out for a walk. It happened between 9:30 p.m. and 10:30 p.m. in the area of Townline Rd. and Wade Rd. Police say there was no interaction between the man and girl, however, a motorist who was passing by noticed the body language of the teen and suspected something was wrong. The motorist stopped and gave the teen a ride to her home. In this incident, the suspect is described as white, roughly five-foot-six, between 40 and 60 years of age, with a medium build and thinning grey or white hair. Police believe it is possible that the same man was involved in both incidents. “We recognize there are some differences between the two incidents, but there are also some similarities being the area of the occurrences, similar ages and sex of the victims, within a day of each other, walking females being approached,” said Niagara police Const. Phil Gavin. “We are still working to obtain some details from the victims and possible witnesses.” Police are asking residents and businesses in the area with security cameras to check their footage for anything that may help identify the person or people involved in these incidents. Anyone with information that could help police with the investigations is asked to contact the detective at 905-688-4111, ext. 1009935. Ontario expands COVID vaccine eligibility - CHCH News Canada & The World Canada News Evening News Home Page News Story Local News Halton Hamilton Ontario News World News WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Search 17.2 C Hamilton Saturday, July 24, 2021 Personalities Contact Us Watch CHCH Live Now! CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Hamilton 50 local artists take part in a city-wide fundraiser for Joseph… Hamilton Two Row on the Grand Summer Camp Canada & The World Canadian government announces additional funding for Hamilton affordable housing Hamilton Two Niagara casinos open for the first time in 16 months WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home Local News Halton Ontario expands COVID vaccine eligibility Local News Halton Hamilton News Home Page News Story Ontario News Top News Story Ontario expands COVID vaccine eligibility By Sylvie Lendvay - May 10, 2021, 11:08 am The province says the eligibility to receive a COVID-19 vaccine will expand the week of May 10th to include people with “at-risk” health conditions, people who cannot work from home (Group 2), and people 40 and older. Starting Tuesday May 11 at 8 a.m, people with “at-risk” health conditions such as immune deficiencies, cancer, diabetes, and asthma will be able to book an appointment either through the provincial portal or their region’s website. Also Tuesday morning, people in Group 2 who cannot work from home including those who work in essential retail, courts and banks can book. Social workers, veterinarians and miners are also apart of the list that can be found here. Thursday May 13 at 8 a.m, people turning 40 in 2021 and older in non-hot spot communities can book a vaccine appointment at a mass immunization clinic. Halton Region has expanded its’ vaccination program to allow residents 16 and older who cannot work from home to book an appointment through the regions online portal. Halton residents 50 and older living in non-hot spot communities can also book. Wednesday May 12 eligibility opens to those 40 and older, Friday May 14 to those 30 and older, and by next week all Halton adults over the age of 16 will be eligible to book an appointment. Halton residents 16+ who cannot work from home can now book a COVID vaccine appointment… as well as anyone 50+. May 12 – 40+. May 14 – 30+. May 19 – 16+. They are following provincial criteria for expanding program based on risk… have enough supply to do it early. @CHCHNews pic.twitter.com/VYwEmaGKLO — Sylvie Lendvay (@sylvie_lendvay) May 10, 2021 Halton region says they are following provincial criteria for expanding eligibility based on who is most at risk, but they have enough supply to do it early. There are several pilot clinics across the province vaccinating residents 18 and older. Four pharmacies in Hamilton are approved to administer Moderna. Each location will receive about 150 shots a week. Adults 40 and older can still book an AstraZeneca vaccine at a participating pharmacy. All booking availability will depend on supply. CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Hamilton 50 local artists take part in a city-wide fundraiser for Joseph… Hamilton Two Row on the Grand Summer Camp Canada & The World Canadian government announces additional funding for Hamilton affordable housing Hamilton Two Niagara casinos open for the first time in 16 months WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home Local News Halton Halton Police are trying to prevent bicycle theft Local News Halton News Halton Police are trying to prevent bicycle theft By Sylvie Lendvay - April 19, 2021, 9:27 am Police Services across Ontario are trying to get ahead of bike thefts. Constable Frank Trasmundi with Halton Police says sometimes when people report their bicycle stolen, the owner won’t have the serial number. If that’s the case, police can’t return it or lay charges. He says downloading the app ‘529 Garage’ can help people file a report. “We will have picture of your bike, the serial number, and any distinguishing features so it will be easier for us to recover it if we find it.” says Trasmundi. Halton Police recovers 200 bikes per year on average. Only about 10-15 of them are returned. CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Hamilton 50 local artists take part in a city-wide fundraiser for Joseph… Hamilton Two Row on the Grand Summer Camp Canada & The World Canadian government announces additional funding for Hamilton affordable housing Hamilton Two Niagara casinos open for the first time in 16 months WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home Local News Halton If you don’t live with someone, assume they have COVID: Burlington Mayor Local News Halton Main News Story News If you don’t live with someone, assume they have COVID: Burlington Mayor By Sylvie Lendvay - December 9, 2020, 10:11 am With cases on the rise in Halton Region, Burlington’s Mayor Marianne Meed Ward residents should be concerned. “The simplest message I could give to residents is this: If you don’t live with somebody, assume that they have COVID and conduct yourself accordingly.” Even with the temptation to gather this holiday season, she is urging residents to follow public health guidelines. “Our [Burlington] numbers are going up again, a little bit. There’s been a lot of talk about a vaccine coming; we know we’re getting that but that’s not the silver bullet. That’s not the only solution. We are going to continue, for at least a year, to need to be keeping physical distance, hand washing, wearing a mask when out in public. Those measures are going to be critically important throughout 2021.” Halton reported 92 new cases of COVID-19 Tuesday. St. Anne Catholic Elementary school in Burlington has had to close down one classroom after 4 cases were reported Tuesday night. There are currently active 14 outbreaks in Halton region. The region’s Medical Officer of Health says the region continues to see community transmission. She is asking residents to avoid carpooling, and having coffee and play dates. Local News Halton News Is Halton heading back to a modified Stage 2? By Laura Brody - October 23, 2020, 8:52 pm Premier Doug Ford is concerned about Halton region’s rising case numbers and says a decision will be made by Monday whether or not to send the region back to modified Stage 2. Halton region is approaching 2,000 total COVID-19 cases; half of which have been recorded in the last two months. “We’re going to have to discuss that over the weekend and we’ll have that answer on Monday. But folks in Halton, I know they’re doing a great job. It’s concerning right now. I’ve seen the numbers go up.” said Premier Doug Ford. “The premier has been terrific to work with throughout this. We recorded 16 new cases today. That’s like 1 in 35,000 people here. I think curves on small numbers are very unreliable ways to judge the future.” said Oakville Mayor Rob Burton. Oakville has already restricted indoor group fitness classes and team sports. The modified Stage 2 would prohibit indoor dining, and close gyms, fitness centres, cinemas and performance venues. The Niagara Falls location will no longer operate on weekends. New hours will be Monday to Friday 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. Welland’s assessment centre is cutting back to Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Hours at the St. Catharines assessment centre remain the same 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. seven days a week. COVID-19 testing at these centres, which are run by Niagara Health, are by-appointment only. CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Local News Attempted robbery at a Burlington store that specializes in garments for… News Province outlines plans for Ontario Place, but the price tag is… Canada News Canada is at the start of a fourth wave of Covid-19,… Local News WATCH NOW: Hamilton police to provide update on brazen shooting at… WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home News Local News Feds invest $400M to cut emissions at ArcelorMittal Dofasco in Hamilton News Local News Top News Story Feds invest $400M to cut emissions at ArcelorMittal Dofasco in Hamilton By Shayla Vize - July 30, 2021, 12:42 pm The federal government is making a $400 million investment to reduce carbon emissions at ArcelorMittal Dofasco in Hamilton. Deputy Prime Minister Chrystia Freeland, made the announcement in Hamilton Friday morning alongside Innovation Minister François-Philippe Champagne and Minister of Labour, Filomena Tassi. The investment is part of a $1.7 billion project to convert the steel production process and phase out coal-fired steelmaking. The project will transition the Hamilton steelmaker to a hydrogen-ready, direct reduced iron–fed electric arc furnace. Officials say this will result in higher productivity, product quality, and energy efficiency at ArcelorMittal Dofasco. “Our government has been steadfast in defending and championing our steel workers. Today’s announcement, through the Net Zero Accelerator, is about investing in the low-carbon transformation of Canadian industry, taking serious action in the global fight against climate change and supporting good middle-class jobs in Hamilton,” stated Freeland in a news release. “We will continue to be there to support growth and a strong economic future for our steel workers and all the people of Hamilton.” ArcelorMittal CEO Aditya Mittal said the announcement represents a historic moment for the steelmaker and will result in a 60 per cent drop in CO2 emissions within the next seven years. The company is Canada’s largest producer of flat-rolled steel and Hamilton’s largest private-sector employer. Federal officials say the project will make a significant contribution toward Canada’s achieving its climate goals, reducing greenhouse gas emissions by up to 3 million tonnes per year by 2030. The data is based on 21,000 completed tests. This is the second time the province has reported over 200 cases in as many days. Health Minister Christine Elliott says there are 62 new cases in Toronto, 35 in the Region of Waterloo, 24 in Peel Region, and 13 in York Region. Ontario is reporting 226 cases of #COVID19 and nearly 21,000 tests completed. Locally, there are 62 new cases in Toronto, 35 in the Region of Waterloo, 24 in Peel Region, 13 in York Region, 13 in Hamilton and 13 in Halton Region. — Christine Elliott (@celliottability) July 30, 2021 There are currently 117 patients in intensive care with COVID-related critical illness and 77 on ventilators. The province says 83,907 doses of a COVID-19 vaccine were administered Thursday for a total of more than 19.3 million. Of the province’s 626 long-term care homes, at least five are in an outbreak including Arbour Creek Long-Term Care Centre in Hamilton, St. Joseph’s Villa in Dundas, Fox Ridge Care Community in Brantford, and The Village of Tansley Woods in Burlington. An active COVID-19 outbreak indicates that the home has at least one lab-confirmed case of COVID-19 (in resident or staff) and the local public health unit or the home has declared an outbreak. CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Local News Attempted robbery at a Burlington store that specializes in garments for… News Province outlines plans for Ontario Place, but the price tag is… Canada News Canada is at the start of a fourth wave of Covid-19,… Local News WATCH NOW: Hamilton police to provide update on brazen shooting at… WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home News Local News Brazen shooting in central Hamilton caught on camera (VIDEO) News Local News Top News Story Brazen shooting in central Hamilton caught on camera (VIDEO) By Shayla Vize - July 30, 2021, 10:46 am VIDEO: CHCH News has obtained exclusive video of a brazen shooting in central Hamilton. Officers were called to the area of Barton St. and Oak Ave. around 5:15 p.m. Wednesday. Police say 23-year-old Donovan Hines was found suffering from gunshot wounds. He was taken to hospital where he remains in serious but stable condition. He is facing seven firearms-related charges, including discharging a firearm with recklessness. A surveillance camera on a nearby home captured the shocking incident unfold. A black, four-door vehicle can be seen slowly pulling up near the side patio of Allure Lounge on Oak Ave. The driver gets out and approaches a vehicle in the parking lot. Suddenly, the driver fires multiple shots into the vehicle through the open driver’s side door and runs back to his car. The man targeted in the parked vehicle then grabs his own gun and fires several shots through his windshield in the direction of the fleeing vehicle. Police are still trying to identify the shooter who fled the scene. They are searching for a 2007 or 2008 black Pontiac G5 and a man between 5’10 and 6 ‘5 in height. Detectives believe this was a targeted incident. Swimmer Penny Oleksiak makes Canadian Olympic history - CHCH News Canada & The World Canada News Evening News Home Page News Story Local News Halton Hamilton Ontario News World News WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Search 19.2 C Hamilton Friday, July 30, 2021 Personalities Contact Us Watch CHCH Live Now! CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Local News Attempted robbery at a Burlington store that specializes in garments for… News Province outlines plans for Ontario Place, but the price tag is… Canada News Canada is at the start of a fourth wave of Covid-19,… Local News WATCH NOW: Hamilton police to provide update on brazen shooting at… WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home News Canada News Swimmer Penny Oleksiak makes Canadian Olympic history News Canada News Top News Story Swimmer Penny Oleksiak makes Canadian Olympic history By Shayla Vize - July 28, 2021, 6:11 am Canadian swimmer Penny Oleksiak has officially become Canada’s most decorated summer Olympian. The 21-year-old won her second medal of the Tokyo 2020 Summer Games by snagging a bronze in the women’s 200m freestyle. The Toronto-native has now won six Olympic medals in her career so far. Oleksiak still has to compete in the 100m freestyle and potentially three more relays — the women’s 4x200m freestyle as well as the women’s and mixed 4x100m medleys, the latter of which is being included on the Olympic program for the first time. This is Oleksiak’s second Summer Games appearance. She had a breakout performance at Rio 2016 where she won four medals. If she earns one more medal, she’ll surpass Cindy Klassen and Clara Hughes to become the nation’s most decorated Olympian of all time. The Grace Anglican Church started the planning process on the centre four years ago. They are calling it “Bobby’s Place”, named after local Bobby Smylie who died from the flu in 2018 at the age of 10. The church says the centre will provide a meeting space to learn, socialize, and grow. Construction on “Bobby’s Place” will begin in a few weeks and they hope to have it finished by the Fall. CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Local News Brantford police investigating shooting in the same neighbourhood a man was… Local News Attempted robbery at a Burlington store that specializes in garments for… News Province outlines plans for Ontario Place, but the price tag is… Canada News Canada is at the start of a fourth wave of Covid-19,… WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home News Evening News Hamilton police arrest man after 26 high-end bikes were stolen News Evening News Local News Hamilton police arrest man after 26 high-end bikes were stolen By Laura Brody - December 24, 2019, 4:59 pm Hamilton police have arrested a man in connection with a two-month long investigation into stolen, high-end bikes worth more than $40 000. Police say they executed a search warrant at a home in the east end last Thursday and found 26 mountain bikes, along with bike parts, high-end skis and prohibited weapons. They believe the bikes were stolen from residential and commercial properties in Ancaster, Aldershot and Dundas. They say most of the bikes had been taken apart and the parts had been swapped, to try to disguise them. So far, police have returned 3 of the 26 bikes to their owners, and hope to return the rest of them in the next two weeks. Jason Kane, 43, of Hamilton, is facing a number of charges including two counts of possession of a prohibited weapon, and three counts of possession of stolen property. Police say the investigation is ongoing and more charges could be laid. They recommend that you record the serial number on your bike, and call police if it’s been stolen. CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Local News WATCH NOW: Hamilton police to provide update on brazen shooting at… Local News Feds invest $400M to cut emissions at ArcelorMittal Dofasco in Hamilton News Ontario reports 226 new COVID-19 cases Friday, 11 more deaths Local News Brazen shooting in central Hamilton caught on camera (VIDEO) WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home News Evening News Suspect identified in the murder of Obsa Junedi Mohamed News Evening News Local News Hamilton Home Page News Story Suspect identified in the murder of Obsa Junedi Mohamed By Laura Brody - October 21, 2019, 6:27 pm Hamilton police have identified the suspect in the city’s tenth homicide of the year, and have issued a warrant for his arrest. Twenty-nine year old Obsa Junedi Mohamed was gunned down outside of Boulevard Billiards on York Boulevard at around 1:30 Saturday morning. Police say his killer was his friend, 26-year-old Ibrahim Issak Hussen. The two men were hanging out with a group of other men for awhile before the shooting. About 10 minutes before the shooting detectives say Junedi Mohamed and Issak Hussen got into a physical altercation. Hussen goes by the street name “Seemo.” Junedi Mohamed’s street name was Nanny or Chappel. Detectives say Hussen shot Mohamed point blank in the head. The whole incident was caught on surveillance video. Surveillance images released in the media led to the driver of the getaway vehicle turning himself in to police on Saturday. That man was arrested for first degree murder and accessory after the fact to murder. Police say he participated in a lengthy interview and was released unconditionally later Saturday. But another man was also in the car and police want to speak to him. They are looking for an Asian male wearing a dark parka with fur trim on the hood. The victim was known to police. He was found by officers hiding after another shooting in the same area back in 2015. At the time he was charged with failing to comply and possession of cocaine. Issak Hussen is also known to police and investigators believe drugs are involved in this incident as well. News Evening News Local News Two Hamilton women were invited to meet Taylor Swift at the star’s Nashville mansion By Laura Brody - August 22, 2019, 5:23 pm Two young women from Hamilton were treated to an experience of a lifetime by their ultra-famous idol- Taylor Swift. The multi-grammy award winning pop star hand selected about 100 mega fans from around the world to attend a secret album preview party at her Nashville mansion and 25-year-old Nichole Ridehalgh and 17-year-old Isabella Rose both got a phone call from Swifts team. Ridehalgh was shocked when she called the call inviting her to a special event. She was asked if she could make it to Nashville in less than a week. Without being told, Ridehalgh knew she had just been invited to an event that is the pinnacle of every Taylor Swift fan’s dream- a secret session album preview at the star’s Nashville mansion. Swift has held secret sessions before the releases of several of her previous albums. Fans are picked up at a secret location and driven to her mansion. Those who attend are always mega fans who the star keeps a close eye on on social media. Getting a one on one chat with the star is something Ridehalgh will never forget. “Its 4:30 in the morning, I’m exhausted but, this is my moment. I walk into the room and I turn to my left and I see her and she says hey your Nichole right?Aand in that moment my whole world was made. Without me mentioning Canada at all, she said have a safe flight back to Canada” Swift even shared secret details about her personal life with fans. Isabella Rose is also on a first name basis with Swift. She posted on social media saying “I have loved her for nine years and I will never stop talking about how much I love her but I would not be where I am today without her.” Tonight is the release of Swift’s newest album, Lover. Ridehalgh and Rose were two of 113 fans in the world, that have already heard it. “She was lip syncing and dancing. She was just having a blast.” And that night is a night these young women will replay over and over again. The Ontario Life Saving Society says not wearing a life jacket was a factor in 88% of boat-related deaths. Alcohol played a part in 40% of boat-related deaths. There were 50 search and rescue calls in the Niagara Region in the year 2020. There have been 33 calls in 2021 so far. It happened at the Giorgio’s No Frills on Main St. East near Tisdale St. South. Hamilton fire says crews arrived to find “visible flames” coming from the store. Firefighters entered the building through the back entrance and managed to extinguish the blaze. No injuries have been reported. NEW | F21015990 | STRUCTURE FIRE | Loc: 400 Block MAIN ST E HAM @ TISDALE ST S/ERIE AV /CN: NO FRILLS | Units: C73,C74 | 07/30/21 06:16 — HamOnt Fire Dept (@HFD_Incidents) July 30, 2021 Shortly after 8 a.m., smoke was still being cleared from the building. Stan Double, Hamilton Fire Platoon Chief, said the Hamilton health department would be attending the scene to make sure the store is safe for customers to enter. Double said food will also be checked to ensure it is safe for consumption. An official cause has yet to be determined but Double says it is likely from an electrical issue. Fire at Giorgio's No Frills in Central #hamont. Platoon chief says likely an electrical issue. No injuries. Ontario expands COVID vaccine eligibility - CHCH News Canada & The World Canada News Evening News Home Page News Story Local News Halton Hamilton Ontario News World News WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Search 15.2 C Hamilton Saturday, July 31, 2021 Personalities Contact Us Watch CHCH Live Now! CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Local News Brantford police investigating shooting in the same neighbourhood a man was… Local News Attempted robbery at a Burlington store that specializes in garments for… News Province outlines plans for Ontario Place, but the price tag is… Canada News Canada is at the start of a fourth wave of Covid-19,… WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home Local News Halton Ontario expands COVID vaccine eligibility Local News Halton Hamilton News Home Page News Story Ontario News Top News Story Ontario expands COVID vaccine eligibility By Sylvie Lendvay - May 10, 2021, 11:08 am The province says the eligibility to receive a COVID-19 vaccine will expand the week of May 10th to include people with “at-risk” health conditions, people who cannot work from home (Group 2), and people 40 and older. Starting Tuesday May 11 at 8 a.m, people with “at-risk” health conditions such as immune deficiencies, cancer, diabetes, and asthma will be able to book an appointment either through the provincial portal or their region’s website. Also Tuesday morning, people in Group 2 who cannot work from home including those who work in essential retail, courts and banks can book. Social workers, veterinarians and miners are also apart of the list that can be found here. Thursday May 13 at 8 a.m, people turning 40 in 2021 and older in non-hot spot communities can book a vaccine appointment at a mass immunization clinic. Halton Region has expanded its’ vaccination program to allow residents 16 and older who cannot work from home to book an appointment through the regions online portal. Halton residents 50 and older living in non-hot spot communities can also book. Wednesday May 12 eligibility opens to those 40 and older, Friday May 14 to those 30 and older, and by next week all Halton adults over the age of 16 will be eligible to book an appointment. Halton residents 16+ who cannot work from home can now book a COVID vaccine appointment… as well as anyone 50+. May 12 – 40+. May 14 – 30+. May 19 – 16+. They are following provincial criteria for expanding program based on risk… have enough supply to do it early. @CHCHNews pic.twitter.com/VYwEmaGKLO — Sylvie Lendvay (@sylvie_lendvay) May 10, 2021 Halton region says they are following provincial criteria for expanding eligibility based on who is most at risk, but they have enough supply to do it early. There are several pilot clinics across the province vaccinating residents 18 and older. Four pharmacies in Hamilton are approved to administer Moderna. Each location will receive about 150 shots a week. Adults 40 and older can still book an AstraZeneca vaccine at a participating pharmacy. All booking availability will depend on supply. CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Local News Brantford police investigating shooting in the same neighbourhood a man was… Local News Attempted robbery at a Burlington store that specializes in garments for… News Province outlines plans for Ontario Place, but the price tag is… Canada News Canada is at the start of a fourth wave of Covid-19,… WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home Local News Halton Halton Police are trying to prevent bicycle theft Local News Halton News Halton Police are trying to prevent bicycle theft By Sylvie Lendvay - April 19, 2021, 9:27 am Police Services across Ontario are trying to get ahead of bike thefts. Constable Frank Trasmundi with Halton Police says sometimes when people report their bicycle stolen, the owner won’t have the serial number. If that’s the case, police can’t return it or lay charges. He says downloading the app ‘529 Garage’ can help people file a report. “We will have picture of your bike, the serial number, and any distinguishing features so it will be easier for us to recover it if we find it.” says Trasmundi. Halton Police recovers 200 bikes per year on average. Only about 10-15 of them are returned. CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Local News Brantford police investigating shooting in the same neighbourhood a man was… Local News Attempted robbery at a Burlington store that specializes in garments for… News Province outlines plans for Ontario Place, but the price tag is… Canada News Canada is at the start of a fourth wave of Covid-19,… WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home Local News Halton If you don’t live with someone, assume they have COVID: Burlington Mayor Local News Halton Main News Story News If you don’t live with someone, assume they have COVID: Burlington Mayor By Sylvie Lendvay - December 9, 2020, 10:11 am With cases on the rise in Halton Region, Burlington’s Mayor Marianne Meed Ward residents should be concerned. “The simplest message I could give to residents is this: If you don’t live with somebody, assume that they have COVID and conduct yourself accordingly.” Even with the temptation to gather this holiday season, she is urging residents to follow public health guidelines. “Our [Burlington] numbers are going up again, a little bit. There’s been a lot of talk about a vaccine coming; we know we’re getting that but that’s not the silver bullet. That’s not the only solution. We are going to continue, for at least a year, to need to be keeping physical distance, hand washing, wearing a mask when out in public. Those measures are going to be critically important throughout 2021.” Halton reported 92 new cases of COVID-19 Tuesday. St. Anne Catholic Elementary school in Burlington has had to close down one classroom after 4 cases were reported Tuesday night. There are currently active 14 outbreaks in Halton region. The region’s Medical Officer of Health says the region continues to see community transmission. She is asking residents to avoid carpooling, and having coffee and play dates. Local News Halton News Is Halton heading back to a modified Stage 2? By Laura Brody - October 23, 2020, 8:52 pm Premier Doug Ford is concerned about Halton region’s rising case numbers and says a decision will be made by Monday whether or not to send the region back to modified Stage 2. Halton region is approaching 2,000 total COVID-19 cases; half of which have been recorded in the last two months. “We’re going to have to discuss that over the weekend and we’ll have that answer on Monday. But folks in Halton, I know they’re doing a great job. It’s concerning right now. I’ve seen the numbers go up.” said Premier Doug Ford. “The premier has been terrific to work with throughout this. We recorded 16 new cases today. That’s like 1 in 35,000 people here. I think curves on small numbers are very unreliable ways to judge the future.” said Oakville Mayor Rob Burton. Oakville has already restricted indoor group fitness classes and team sports. The modified Stage 2 would prohibit indoor dining, and close gyms, fitness centres, cinemas and performance venues. The Niagara Falls location will no longer operate on weekends. New hours will be Monday to Friday 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. Welland’s assessment centre is cutting back to Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Hours at the St. Catharines assessment centre remain the same 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. seven days a week. Canada defeated Sweden 3-2 on penalty kicks after the game was tied 1-1 following extra time. Canadian Julia Grosso scored the winner to end it after goalkeeper Stephanie Labbe denied Jonna Andersson’s attempt. OLYMPIC CHAMPS 🤩🎉🙌@GrossoJulia scores ⚽️ to seal #TeamCanada’s gold medal win at #Tokyo2020 🥇 See the moment on @CBCOlympics ⬇️ pic.twitter.com/t2StiMHAVj — Team Canada (@TeamCanada) August 6, 2021 It’s the first-ever Olympic title for the Canadian women’s soccer team. The team won bronze medals at London 2012 and Rio 2016. Christine Sinclair, Sophie Schmidt, and Desiree Scott are now three-time Olympic medallists, while 11 other players became two-time medallists. A CANADIAN HERITAGE MOMENT 🇨🇦 pic.twitter.com/fh7EE6Hsf4 — Team Canada (@TeamCanada) August 6, 2021 🇨🇦 THEY DID IT!!! Niagara police say Todd Bennett, of St. Catharines, faces one count of sexual assault. Police were contacted back in June about a sexual assault at a registered massage clinic and wellness center in the area of Dunn St. and Drummond Rd. The alleged incident happened during a scheduled massage therapy appointment at the clinic. “Investigators believe there may be additional complainants and are asking anyone who has information to contact them,” said police in a news release. Bennett has been held in custody and will appear in court on Friday. Anyone with information that could help police with the investigation is asked to contact the Sexual Assault Unit at 905-688-4111, ext. 1009363. Ahmed was born in Somalia but grew up in St. Catharines, Ont. Ahmed’s time was 12:58.61, putting him 0.46 behind gold medallist Joshua Cheptegei of Uganda. The 30-year-old had recorded Canada’s best-ever Olympic result in the 5000m at Rio 2016 where he finished fourth. He came to Tokyo with the third-fastest time in the world this year in the distance. Home News Ontario News OPP responds to five fatalities over ‘most tragic long weekend of the... News Ontario News Top News Story OPP responds to five fatalities over ‘most tragic long weekend of the year’ By Shayla Vize - August 6, 2021, 6:54 am Ontario Provincial Police (OPP) says the recent Civic Holiday weekend was the “most tragic long weekend of the year” with five lives lost. Police say a motor vehicle driver, a motorcyclist, two off-roaders and a kayaker were killed in separate incidents over the weekend. The incidents mark the 145th vehicle occupant, 20th motorcyclist, 18th boater, and 10th off-road vehicle rider deaths of the year in OPP jurisdictions. Police also laid more than 6,300 traffic-related charges between July 30 and Aug. 2. OPP says aggressive drivers posed a significant risk on highways and roads with 4,117 speeding offence notices issued and 116 stunt/racing charges laid. Officers issued 126 offence notices to drivers who failed to slow down and/or move over for emergency vehicles and tow trucks parked on the roadside while providing assistance to motorists. Police also handed out 199 seat belt, 95 alcohol/drug-impaired and 83 distracted driving charges, as well as 51 marine-related and 37 off-road vehicle-related charges. Police are reminding citizens of the important role they play in keeping everyone safe while out on our roads, waterways, and trails. Dunfee finished with a season-best time of three hours, 50 minutes, and 59 seconds. He came into the Games as the reigning world bronze medallist. The 30-year-old from Richmond, B-C is the first – and likely will be the only – Canadian to win an Olympic medal in the event. The IOC is dropping race walk from the Summer Games program. The Grace Anglican Church started the planning process on the centre four years ago. They are calling it “Bobby’s Place”, named after local Bobby Smylie who died from the flu in 2018 at the age of 10. The church says the centre will provide a meeting space to learn, socialize, and grow. Construction on “Bobby’s Place” will begin in a few weeks and they hope to have it finished by the Fall. Hamilton police arrest man after 26 high-end bikes were stolen - CHCH News Canada & The World Canada News Evening News Home Page News Story Local News Halton Hamilton Ontario News World News WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Search 29.5 C Hamilton Friday, August 6, 2021 Personalities Contact Us Watch CHCH Live Now! CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Local News Hamilton City Hall evacuated as police investigate threat Ontario News Ontario reports 340 new COVID-19 cases Friday Canada News Canada beats Sweden in shootout to win gold medal in women’s… Local News Niagara Falls massage therapist charged with sexual assault WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home News Evening News Hamilton police arrest man after 26 high-end bikes were stolen News Evening News Local News Hamilton police arrest man after 26 high-end bikes were stolen By Laura Brody - December 24, 2019, 4:59 pm Hamilton police have arrested a man in connection with a two-month long investigation into stolen, high-end bikes worth more than $40 000. Police say they executed a search warrant at a home in the east end last Thursday and found 26 mountain bikes, along with bike parts, high-end skis and prohibited weapons. They believe the bikes were stolen from residential and commercial properties in Ancaster, Aldershot and Dundas. They say most of the bikes had been taken apart and the parts had been swapped, to try to disguise them. So far, police have returned 3 of the 26 bikes to their owners, and hope to return the rest of them in the next two weeks. Jason Kane, 43, of Hamilton, is facing a number of charges including two counts of possession of a prohibited weapon, and three counts of possession of stolen property. Police say the investigation is ongoing and more charges could be laid. They recommend that you record the serial number on your bike, and call police if it’s been stolen. CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Local News Pair of Hamilton city councilors want rental units licensed so they… Local News Vaccination numbers not high enough to move beyond the current step… News The elusive dream of home ownership Local News Hamilton City Hall evacuated as police investigate threat WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home News Evening News Suspect identified in the murder of Obsa Junedi Mohamed News Evening News Local News Hamilton Home Page News Story Suspect identified in the murder of Obsa Junedi Mohamed By Laura Brody - October 21, 2019, 6:27 pm Hamilton police have identified the suspect in the city’s tenth homicide of the year, and have issued a warrant for his arrest. Twenty-nine year old Obsa Junedi Mohamed was gunned down outside of Boulevard Billiards on York Boulevard at around 1:30 Saturday morning. Police say his killer was his friend, 26-year-old Ibrahim Issak Hussen. The two men were hanging out with a group of other men for awhile before the shooting. About 10 minutes before the shooting detectives say Junedi Mohamed and Issak Hussen got into a physical altercation. Hussen goes by the street name “Seemo.” Junedi Mohamed’s street name was Nanny or Chappel. Detectives say Hussen shot Mohamed point blank in the head. The whole incident was caught on surveillance video. Surveillance images released in the media led to the driver of the getaway vehicle turning himself in to police on Saturday. That man was arrested for first degree murder and accessory after the fact to murder. Police say he participated in a lengthy interview and was released unconditionally later Saturday. But another man was also in the car and police want to speak to him. They are looking for an Asian male wearing a dark parka with fur trim on the hood. The victim was known to police. He was found by officers hiding after another shooting in the same area back in 2015. At the time he was charged with failing to comply and possession of cocaine. Issak Hussen is also known to police and investigators believe drugs are involved in this incident as well. News Evening News Local News Two Hamilton women were invited to meet Taylor Swift at the star’s Nashville mansion By Laura Brody - August 22, 2019, 5:23 pm Two young women from Hamilton were treated to an experience of a lifetime by their ultra-famous idol- Taylor Swift. The multi-grammy award winning pop star hand selected about 100 mega fans from around the world to attend a secret album preview party at her Nashville mansion and 25-year-old Nichole Ridehalgh and 17-year-old Isabella Rose both got a phone call from Swifts team. Ridehalgh was shocked when she called the call inviting her to a special event. She was asked if she could make it to Nashville in less than a week. Without being told, Ridehalgh knew she had just been invited to an event that is the pinnacle of every Taylor Swift fan’s dream- a secret session album preview at the star’s Nashville mansion. Swift has held secret sessions before the releases of several of her previous albums. Fans are picked up at a secret location and driven to her mansion. Those who attend are always mega fans who the star keeps a close eye on on social media. Getting a one on one chat with the star is something Ridehalgh will never forget. “Its 4:30 in the morning, I’m exhausted but, this is my moment. I walk into the room and I turn to my left and I see her and she says hey your Nichole right?Aand in that moment my whole world was made. Without me mentioning Canada at all, she said have a safe flight back to Canada” Swift even shared secret details about her personal life with fans. Isabella Rose is also on a first name basis with Swift. She posted on social media saying “I have loved her for nine years and I will never stop talking about how much I love her but I would not be where I am today without her.” Tonight is the release of Swift’s newest album, Lover. Ridehalgh and Rose were two of 113 fans in the world, that have already heard it. “She was lip syncing and dancing. She was just having a blast.” And that night is a night these young women will replay over and over again. Emergency crews were called to a serious collision in the area of Bronte Rd. and Khalsa Gate at 8:18 p.m. Thursday. Police say a 70-year-old woman from Oakville was crossing Bronte Rd. when she was struck by a southbound black Cadillac SUV. The woman was pronounced dead at the scene. Investigators say the driver of the SUV remained at the scene and is cooperating with police. The Collision Reconstruction Unit has taken over the investigation. Anyone with information that could help police is asked to contact 905-825-4747, ext. 5065. CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Local News Pair of Hamilton city councilors want rental units licensed so they… Local News Vaccination numbers not high enough to move beyond the current step… News The elusive dream of home ownership Local News Hamilton City Hall evacuated as police investigate threat WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home News Local News Search continues for missing 27-year-old man in Niagara River News Local News Top News Story Search continues for missing 27-year-old man in Niagara River By Shayla Vize - August 5, 2021, 10:47 am The Niagara Regional Police Marine Unit will continue its search Thursday for a missing 27-year-old man in the Niagara River. The Toronto man disappeared in the water on Sunday after he tried to help a friend who was struggling in the current. The pair had entered the waters while out for a hike with a group of friends from Toronto. Police arrived on scene and pulled a 22-year-old woman from the water in critical condition. She was then transported on a Niagara Jet Boat to the docks in Queenston and taken to hospital via ambulance where she later died. Officers from the Niagara Police Parks High Angle River Team, the Niagara police marine unit, the United States Coast Guard, the Canadian Coast Guard, and Niagara Jet Boats conducted vessel-based and shoreline searches for the man but he was not located. On Wednesday, the Marine Unit moved its search efforts to focus on the mouth of the river at Lake Ontario. Niagara police say officers will continue to search that area Thursday as well as the lower Niagara River. Ontario expands COVID vaccine eligibility - CHCH News Canada & The World Canada News Evening News Home Page News Story Local News Halton Hamilton Ontario News World News WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Search 28.9 C Hamilton Friday, August 6, 2021 Personalities Contact Us Watch CHCH Live Now! CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Local News Hamilton City Hall evacuated as police investigate threat Ontario News Ontario reports 340 new COVID-19 cases Friday Canada News Canada beats Sweden in shootout to win gold medal in women’s… Local News Niagara Falls massage therapist charged with sexual assault WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home Local News Halton Ontario expands COVID vaccine eligibility Local News Halton Hamilton News Home Page News Story Ontario News Top News Story Ontario expands COVID vaccine eligibility By Sylvie Lendvay - May 10, 2021, 11:08 am The province says the eligibility to receive a COVID-19 vaccine will expand the week of May 10th to include people with “at-risk” health conditions, people who cannot work from home (Group 2), and people 40 and older. Starting Tuesday May 11 at 8 a.m, people with “at-risk” health conditions such as immune deficiencies, cancer, diabetes, and asthma will be able to book an appointment either through the provincial portal or their region’s website. Also Tuesday morning, people in Group 2 who cannot work from home including those who work in essential retail, courts and banks can book. Social workers, veterinarians and miners are also apart of the list that can be found here. Thursday May 13 at 8 a.m, people turning 40 in 2021 and older in non-hot spot communities can book a vaccine appointment at a mass immunization clinic. Halton Region has expanded its’ vaccination program to allow residents 16 and older who cannot work from home to book an appointment through the regions online portal. Halton residents 50 and older living in non-hot spot communities can also book. Wednesday May 12 eligibility opens to those 40 and older, Friday May 14 to those 30 and older, and by next week all Halton adults over the age of 16 will be eligible to book an appointment. Halton residents 16+ who cannot work from home can now book a COVID vaccine appointment… as well as anyone 50+. May 12 – 40+. May 14 – 30+. May 19 – 16+. They are following provincial criteria for expanding program based on risk… have enough supply to do it early. @CHCHNews pic.twitter.com/VYwEmaGKLO — Sylvie Lendvay (@sylvie_lendvay) May 10, 2021 Halton region says they are following provincial criteria for expanding eligibility based on who is most at risk, but they have enough supply to do it early. There are several pilot clinics across the province vaccinating residents 18 and older. Four pharmacies in Hamilton are approved to administer Moderna. Each location will receive about 150 shots a week. Adults 40 and older can still book an AstraZeneca vaccine at a participating pharmacy. All booking availability will depend on supply. Constable Frank Trasmundi with Halton Police says sometimes when people report their bicycle stolen, the owner won’t have the serial number. If that’s the case, police can’t return it or lay charges. He says downloading the app ‘529 Garage’ can help people file a report. “We will have picture of your bike, the serial number, and any distinguishing features so it will be easier for us to recover it if we find it.” says Trasmundi. Halton Police recovers 200 bikes per year on average. Only about 10-15 of them are returned. If you don't live with someone, assume they have COVID: Burlington Mayor - CHCH News Canada & The World Canada News Evening News Home Page News Story Local News Halton Hamilton Ontario News World News WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Search 29.5 C Hamilton Friday, August 6, 2021 Personalities Contact Us Watch CHCH Live Now! CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Local News Hamilton City Hall evacuated as police investigate threat Ontario News Ontario reports 340 new COVID-19 cases Friday Canada News Canada beats Sweden in shootout to win gold medal in women’s… Local News Niagara Falls massage therapist charged with sexual assault WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home Local News Halton If you don’t live with someone, assume they have COVID: Burlington Mayor Local News Halton Main News Story News If you don’t live with someone, assume they have COVID: Burlington Mayor By Sylvie Lendvay - December 9, 2020, 10:11 am With cases on the rise in Halton Region, Burlington’s Mayor Marianne Meed Ward residents should be concerned. “The simplest message I could give to residents is this: If you don’t live with somebody, assume that they have COVID and conduct yourself accordingly.” Even with the temptation to gather this holiday season, she is urging residents to follow public health guidelines. “Our [Burlington] numbers are going up again, a little bit. There’s been a lot of talk about a vaccine coming; we know we’re getting that but that’s not the silver bullet. That’s not the only solution. We are going to continue, for at least a year, to need to be keeping physical distance, hand washing, wearing a mask when out in public. Those measures are going to be critically important throughout 2021.” Halton reported 92 new cases of COVID-19 Tuesday. St. Anne Catholic Elementary school in Burlington has had to close down one classroom after 4 cases were reported Tuesday night. There are currently active 14 outbreaks in Halton region. The region’s Medical Officer of Health says the region continues to see community transmission. She is asking residents to avoid carpooling, and having coffee and play dates. Local News Halton News Is Halton heading back to a modified Stage 2? By Laura Brody - October 23, 2020, 8:52 pm Premier Doug Ford is concerned about Halton region’s rising case numbers and says a decision will be made by Monday whether or not to send the region back to modified Stage 2. Halton region is approaching 2,000 total COVID-19 cases; half of which have been recorded in the last two months. “We’re going to have to discuss that over the weekend and we’ll have that answer on Monday. But folks in Halton, I know they’re doing a great job. It’s concerning right now. I’ve seen the numbers go up.” said Premier Doug Ford. “The premier has been terrific to work with throughout this. We recorded 16 new cases today. That’s like 1 in 35,000 people here. I think curves on small numbers are very unreliable ways to judge the future.” said Oakville Mayor Rob Burton. Oakville has already restricted indoor group fitness classes and team sports. The modified Stage 2 would prohibit indoor dining, and close gyms, fitness centres, cinemas and performance venues. The Niagara Falls location will no longer operate on weekends. New hours will be Monday to Friday 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. Welland’s assessment centre is cutting back to Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Hours at the St. Catharines assessment centre remain the same 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. seven days a week. CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Ontario News Ontario reports 510 new COVID-19 cases Friday Local News Two Hamilton men charged in sexual assault of teenage boy Local News Motorcyclists head to Port Dover for Friday the 13th rally Ontario News Driver killed in fiery crash with truck on Toronto highway WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home News Ontario News Ontario reports 510 new COVID-19 cases Friday News Ontario News Top News Story Ontario reports 510 new COVID-19 cases Friday By Shayla Vize - August 13, 2021, 1:08 pm Ontario is reporting 510 new cases of COVID-19 Friday and four additional deaths. The Ministry of Health says two of the deaths occurred more than two months ago. The data is based on more than 23,500 tests completed on the previous day. It is the second day in a row the province reported more than 500 new cases. The province says 368 of the positive cases were in unvaccinated individuals, 57 were in partially vaccinated and 85 in fully vaccinated. More than half of Friday’s cases are in people aged 20 to 39. There are currently 111 patients in intensive care with COVID-related critical illness and 72 on ventilators. The province says 48,682 doses of a COVID-19 vaccine were administered Thursday for a total of more than 20 million. Of the province’s 626 long-term care homes, at least three are in an outbreak including West Park Health Centre in St. Catharines. An active COVID-19 outbreak indicates that the home has at least one lab-confirmed case of COVID-19 (in resident or staff) and the local public health unit or the home has declared an outbreak. Home News Local News Two Hamilton men charged in sexual assault of teenage boy News Local News Top News Story Two Hamilton men charged in sexual assault of teenage boy By Shayla Vize - August 13, 2021, 12:49 pm Hamilton police have arrested two men in connection with the sexual assault of a teenage boy and investigators believe there may be more victims. Back in June, police launched an investigation into the sexual assault of a 15-year-old boy. Two men from Hamilton were arrested and charged in relation to the assault. Paul Douglas Munro, 60, has been charged with sexual assault cause bodily harm and sexual interference. Joseph Hilray Huff, 26, has been charged with possession of child pornography. Police allege the men would target vulnerable and transient people and transport them in a red SUV to a Hamilton residence where they were sexually assaulted. Hamilton police are encouraging anybody with information to contact Det. Ryan Hashimoto at 905-546-4823 or Det. Lauren Troubridge 905-546-4854. CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News News Gunfire sends one of the GTA’s biggest mall into lockdown Ontario News Ontario reports 510 new COVID-19 cases Friday Local News Two Hamilton men charged in sexual assault of teenage boy Local News Motorcyclists head to Port Dover for Friday the 13th rally WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home News Local News Motorcyclists head to Port Dover for Friday the 13th rally News Local News Top News Story Motorcyclists head to Port Dover for Friday the 13th rally By Shayla Vize - August 13, 2021, 12:24 pm The long-established Friday the 13th motorcycle rally is underway in Port Dover with safety protocols and COVID-19 restrictions in place. The sound of music and roaring of motorcycles was beginning to fill the air around 8 a.m. Friday as bikers made their way into the lakeside town for the traditional gathering. The festivities are expected to look slightly different today due to the pandemic. Port Dover councillor Amy Martin said the county did not issue permits for vendors who normally set up tents selling merchandise along the strip. Earlier this week, Norfolk County mayor Kristal Chopp said there would be no entertainment and noted the province’s limitations of 100 people for an outdoor gathering. Before the pandemic, the event would bring in nearly 200,000 motorcycle enthusiasts. Last November, roughly 3,000 people showed up. Acting Ontario Provincial Police Sgt. Ed Sanchuk was on site Friday morning and was surprised at the number of visitors. “I was actually shocked that we didn’t have a line of motorcycles coming into town,” said Sanchuk. “I think when we actually have people coming down here, but most are coming in and then leaving.” Sanchuk believes traffic will get heavier throughout the day but says there is no way of knowing exactly how many people will take part in the rally. “Right now it’s a roll of dice for how many people we are going to be expecting today. But I can tell you there is an increased police presence and we will respond to any calls of service that may come our way,” said Sanchuk. “Please make sure you enjoy yourself in a safe and responsible manner. Properly distance yourself and follow the proper guidelines.” Slow start to #FridayThe13th however #Motorcycle enthusiasts are arriving in #PortDover. Please make sure YOU #PayAttention and #drivesafe. Remember to check twice it will save a life! @NorfolkCountyCA #NorfolkOPP ^es pic.twitter.com/e4vOAHq9vn — OPP West Region (@OPP_WR) August 13, 2021 TAGS ed sanchuk norfolk county port dover Share Facebook Twitter Pinterest Linkedin Email Print Previous articleGoing for the goal-ie Next articleTwo Hamilton men charged in sexual assault of teenage boy Shayla Vize RELATED ARTICLESMORE FROM AUTHOR News Gunfire sends one of the GTA’s biggest mall into lockdown Ontario News Ontario reports 510 new COVID-19 cases Friday Local News Two Hamilton men charged in sexual assault of teenage boy Ontario News Driver killed in fiery crash with truck on Toronto highway Local News Three residents charged in Port Colborne drug investigation Local News St. Catharines man charged after police recover 5 stolen vehicle LEAVE A REPLY Cancel reply Please enter your comment! It happened around 3:30 a.m. Friday in the eastbound lanes of Highway 401 near Dufferin St. Police responded to reports of a collision involving a car that collided into the back of a transport truck that was stopped in a live lane of traffic. Sgt. Kerry Schmidt says the collision caused a fire in the car. The driver was pronounced dead at the scene. No one else was injured in the crash. Schmidt says the eastbound lanes will be shut down for part of the day as police investigate. CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Canada & The World NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh outlines pre-campaign platform ahead of a looming… News Gunfire sends one of the GTA’s biggest mall into lockdown Canada & The World Hamilton City Councillor Chad Collins announces he’s running for the Federal… Ontario News Ontario reports 510 new COVID-19 cases Friday WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home News Canada News Canadians will soon be able to get vaccine passport for international travel News Canada News Top News Story Canadians will soon be able to get vaccine passport for international travel By Dominick Nagy - August 11, 2021, 8:44 pm Canada’s Immigration Minister says fully vaccinated Canadians will soon be able to get a government document that will certify their covid-19 vaccine history for the purpose of international travel. The document, expected to be ready by the fall, will be digital, with an option for those who can’t or don’t want a digital certificate. It will include data on the type of vaccines received, the dates, and the location. Intergovernmental Affairs Minister Dominic LeBlanc says the program has to be done in co-operation with provinces and territories because they have the data that is needed. China sentences Canadian to 11 years in case tied to Huawei - CHCH News Canada & The World Canada News Evening News Home Page News Story Local News Halton Hamilton Ontario News World News WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Search 23.7 C Hamilton Friday, August 13, 2021 Personalities Contact Us Watch CHCH Live Now! CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Canada & The World NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh outlines pre-campaign platform ahead of a looming… News Gunfire sends one of the GTA’s biggest mall into lockdown Canada & The World Hamilton City Councillor Chad Collins announces he’s running for the Federal… Ontario News Ontario reports 510 new COVID-19 cases Friday WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home News Canada News China sentences Canadian to 11 years in case tied to Huawei News Canada News China sentences Canadian to 11 years in case tied to Huawei By Shayla Vize - August 11, 2021, 9:22 am A Chinese court has sentenced a Canadian businessman to 11 years in prison for espionage, more than two years after he was first detained. Michael Spavor was found guilty of spying and illegally providing state secrets to foreign countries. Spavor and former Canadian diplomat Michael Kovrig were detained in December 2018. Many critics believe the pair was arrested in a move of hostage politics after Huawei executive Meng Wanzhou was arrested in December 2018 at the Vancouver airport. Prime Minister Justin Trudeau issued a statement following the verdict, calling it “absolutely unacceptable and unjust.” “The verdict for Mr. Spavor comes after more than two and a half years of arbitrary detention, a lack of transparency in the legal process, and a trial that did not satisfy even the minimum standards required by international law,” the statement reads. “For Mr. Spavor, as well as for Michael Kovrig who has also been arbitrarily detained, our top priority remains securing their immediate release. We will continue working around the clock to bring them home as soon as possible. Our thoughts, and the thoughts of all Canadians, are with Mr. Spavor and his loved ones during this incredibly difficult time. The Government of Canada continues to provide consular assistance to Mr. Spavor and his family as we work to secure his safe return.” Canadian Ambassador Dominic Barton says Spavor has two weeks to decide whether to appeal. The Dandong Intermediate People’s Court said Spavor would be deported, without specifying whether it was before or after he served his prison sentence. The Grace Anglican Church started the planning process on the centre four years ago. They are calling it “Bobby’s Place”, named after local Bobby Smylie who died from the flu in 2018 at the age of 10. The church says the centre will provide a meeting space to learn, socialize, and grow. Construction on “Bobby’s Place” will begin in a few weeks and they hope to have it finished by the Fall. Hamilton police arrest man after 26 high-end bikes were stolen - CHCH News Canada & The World Canada News Evening News Home Page News Story Local News Halton Hamilton Ontario News World News WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Search 20.9 C Hamilton Friday, August 13, 2021 Personalities Contact Us Watch CHCH Live Now! CHCH News AllCanada & The WorldCanada NewsEvening NewsHome Page News StoryLocal NewsHaltonHamiltonOntario NewsWorld News Canada & The World NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh outlines pre-campaign platform ahead of a looming… News Gunfire sends one of the GTA’s biggest mall into lockdown Canada & The World Hamilton City Councillor Chad Collins announces he’s running for the Federal… Ontario News Ontario reports 510 new COVID-19 cases Friday WATCH NOW Weather Traffic Shows Shows Dateline Shows ER Shows Evening News Shows 20/20 Shows Inside The Story SEE ALL SHOWS Morning Live Schedule SHOP LOCAL Chching Home News Evening News Hamilton police arrest man after 26 high-end bikes were stolen News Evening News Local News Hamilton police arrest man after 26 high-end bikes were stolen By Laura Brody - December 24, 2019, 4:59 pm Hamilton police have arrested a man in connection with a two-month long investigation into stolen, high-end bikes worth more than $40 000. Police say they executed a search warrant at a home in the east end last Thursday and found 26 mountain bikes, along with bike parts, high-end skis and prohibited weapons. They believe the bikes were stolen from residential and commercial properties in Ancaster, Aldershot and Dundas. They say most of the bikes had been taken apart and the parts had been swapped, to try to disguise them. So far, police have returned 3 of the 26 bikes to their owners, and hope to return the rest of them in the next two weeks. Jason Kane, 43, of Hamilton, is facing a number of charges including two counts of possession of a prohibited weapon, and three counts of possession of stolen property. Police say the investigation is ongoing and more charges could be laid. They recommend that you record the serial number on your bike, and call police if it’s been stolen.
